content:
ToolStripRenderer Class

Definition

Handles the painting functionality for ToolStrip objects.

In this Article

public abstract class ToolStripRenderer
Inheritance
System.Object
ToolStripRenderer

Inherited Members

Equals(Object)
Equals(Object,Object)
GetHashCode()
GetType()
MemberwiseClone()
ReferenceEquals(Object,Object)
ToString()

Remarks

Use the ToolStripRenderer class to apply a particular style or theme to a ToolStrip. Rather than custom painting a ToolStrip and the ToolStripItem objects it contains, you set the Renderer property to an object that inherits from ToolStripRenderer. The painting specified by the ToolStripRenderer is applied to the ToolStrip, as well as the items it contains.

You can do custom painting in ToolStrip controls in several ways. As with other Windows Forms controls, the ToolStrip and ToolStripItem both have overridable OnPaint methods and Paint events. As with regular painting, the coordinate system is relative to the client area of the control; that is, the upper left-hand corner of the control is 0, 0. The Paint event and OnPaint method for a ToolStripItem behave like other control paint events.

The ToolStripRenderer class has overridable methods for painting the background, item background, item image, item arrow, item text, and border of the ToolStrip. The event arguments for these methods expose several properties such as rectangles, colors, and text formats that you can adjust as desired.

To adjust just a few aspects of how an item is painted, you typically override the ToolStripRenderer.

If you are writing a new item and want to control all aspects of the painting, override the OnPaint method. From within OnPaint, you can use methods from the ToolStripRenderer.

By default, the ToolStrip is double buffered, taking advantage of the ControlStyles setting.

Constructors

ToolStripRenderer()

Initializes a new instance of the ToolStripRenderer class.

protected ToolStripRenderer ();

Remarks

ToolStripRenderer is an abstract class, so the constructor is only available to classes derived from it.

Fields

Offset2X

Gets or sets the offset multiplier for twice the offset along the x-axis.

protected static int Offset2X;

Offset2Y

Gets or sets the offset multiplier for twice the offset along the y axis.

protected static int Offset2Y;

Methods

Creates a gray-scale copy of a given image.

public static System.Drawing.Image CreateDisabledImage (System.Drawing.Image normalImage);
normalImage
Image

The image to be copied.

Returns
Image

An Image that is a copy of the given image, but with a gray-scale color matrix.

DrawArrow(ToolStripArrowRenderEventArgs)

Draws an arrow on a ToolStripItem.

public void DrawArrow (System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripArrowRenderEventArgs e);
e
ToolStripArrowRenderEventArgs

A ToolStripArrowRenderEventArgs that contains data to draw the arrow.

Remarks

The DrawArrow method provides an entry point to the arrow rendering code. Use this method to draw an arrow when overriding the OnPaint method, or to force an arrow to be drawn in a custom ToolStripRenderer. To change the way an arrow is rendered, override the OnRenderArrow method in a class derived from ToolStripRenderer.

DrawButtonBackground(ToolStripItemRenderEventArgs)

Draws the background for a ToolStripButton.

public void DrawButtonBackground (System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripItemRenderEventArgs e);
e
ToolStripItemRenderEventArgs

The ToolStripItemRenderEventArgs that contains data to draw the button's background.

Remarks

The DrawButtonBackground method provides an entry point to the rendering code for the background of a ToolStripButton. Use this method to draw the background of a button when overriding the OnPaint method, or to force the background of a button to be drawn in a custom ToolStripRenderer. To change the way the background is rendered, override the OnRenderButtonBackground method in a class derived from ToolStripRenderer.

DrawDropDownButtonBackground(ToolStripItemRenderEventArgs)

Draws the background for a ToolStripDropDownButton.

public void DrawDropDownButtonBackground (System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripItemRenderEventArgs e);
e
ToolStripItemRenderEventArgs

A ToolStripItemRenderEventArgs that contains the data to draw the drop-down button's background.

Remarks

The DrawDropDownButtonBackground method provides the entry point to the rendering code for the background of a ToolStripDropDownButton. Use this method to draw the background of a drop-down button when overriding the OnPaint method, or to force the background of a drop-down button to be drawn in a custom ToolStripRenderer. To change the way the background is rendered, override the OnRenderDropDownButtonBackground method in a class derived from ToolStripRenderer.

DrawGrip(ToolStripGripRenderEventArgs)

Draws a move handle on a ToolStrip.

public void DrawGrip (System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripGripRenderEventArgs e);
e
ToolStripGripRenderEventArgs

A ToolStripGripRenderEventArgs that contains the data to draw the move handle.

Remarks

The DrawGrip method provides an entry point to the rendering code for a move handle located on a ToolStrip. Use this method when overriding the OnPaintGrip method, or to force a move handle to be drawn in a custom ToolStripRenderer. To change the way a move handle is rendered, override the OnRenderGrip method in a class derived from ToolStripRenderer.

public void DrawImageMargin (System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripRenderEventArgs e);
e
ToolStripRenderEventArgs

A ToolStripRenderEventArgs that contains the data to draw the space around the image.

Remarks

The DrawImageMargin method provides the entry point to the rendering code for the image. Use this method to draw the image margin when overriding the OnPaint method, or to force the image margin to be drawn in a custom ToolStripRenderer. To change the way the image margin is rendered, override the OnRenderImageMargin method in a class derived from ToolStripRenderer.

e

To change the way the background of an item is rendered, override the OnRenderItemBackground method in a class derived from ToolStripRenderer.

Initialize(ToolStrip)

When overridden in a derived class, provides for custom initialization of the given ToolStrip.

protected virtual void Initialize (System.Windows.Forms.ToolStrip toolStrip);
toolStrip
ToolStrip

The ToolStrip to be initialized.

Remarks

Use the Initialize method to set properties, such as the BackColor or Font, when a ToolStrip is rendered.

OnRenderArrow(ToolStripArrowRenderEventArgs)

Raises the RenderArrow event.

protected virtual void OnRenderArrow (System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripArrowRenderEventArgs e);
e
ToolStripArrowRenderEventArgs

A ToolStripArrowRenderEventArgs that contains the event data.

Remarks

Raising an event invokes the event handler through a delegate. For more information, see Events.

The OnRenderArrow method also allows derived classes to handle the event without attaching a delegate. This is the preferred technique for handling the event in a derived class.

ScaleArrowOffsetsIfNeeded()

Applies the F:System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripRenderer.Offset2X and F:System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripRenderer.Offset2Y specified to scaling the arrow icon, if scaling is required per the DPI settings of the computer.

protected static void ScaleArrowOffsetsIfNeeded ();
